prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): SPMA 1P91 (minimum 60 percent) and 1P92 (minimum 60 percent).

course_description: Introduction to financial principles. Topics include for-profit and non-profit budgeting, bookkeeping, financial accounting, grant applications and taxation.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): SPMA 1P91 (minimum 60 percent) and 1P92 (minimum 60 percent).

prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): SPMA 1P91 (minimum 60 percent) and 1P92 (minimum 60 percent).

course_description: Introduction to marketing concepts and strategies utilized in the sport industry. Topics include the marketing planning process, market research and segmentation, the components of the marketing mix, and promotional and pricing concepts.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): SPMA 1P91 (minimum 60 percent) and SPMA 1P92 (minimum 60 percent).

course_description: Introduction to marketing concepts and strategies utilized in the sport industry. Topics include the marketing planning process, market research and segmentation, the components of the marketing mix, and promotional and pricing concepts.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): SPMA 1P91 (minimum 60 percent) and SPMA 1P92 (minimum 60 percent).

course_description: Critical approach to sport as labour and professional athletes as workers. Topics may include the history of labour organizing and labour relations in professional sports, collective bargaining, strikes, and lockouts, and how axes of inequality, including race, gender, and sexuality, shape athletes' experiences of work.
prerequisites: Crosslisting: also offered as LABR 2P90

course_name: Public Relations & Comm for Sport Management
course_description: Introduction to community relations and content development for internal/external communication, emphasizing electronic, digital and social media.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): SPMA 1P94.

course_description: Masculinities and the relation between multiple dimensions of social relations and inequalities across the lifespan: gender, race/ethnicity, class and sexual orientation. How masculinities are produced in varied sport, social, historical and cultural sites.

course_description: Sport-related legal issues and concepts. Topics may include negligence and liability, risk management, violence, discrimination, doping, employment and labour law, principles of procedural fairness.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): SPMA 1P91 (minimum 60 percent) and 1P92 (minimum 60 percent).

course_description: Sport-related legal issues and concepts. Topics may include negligence and liability, risk management, violence, discrimination, doping, employment and labour law, principles of procedural fairness.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): SPMA 1P91 (minimum 60 percent) and 1P92 (minimum 60 percent).

course_description: Examination of traditional and niche events in sport at local, provincial, national and international levels. Topics include phases in the planning model, concept of facilitation, contingency planning, environmental sustainability, bid process and the politics of events.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): SPMA 1P91 (minimum 60 percent) and 1P92 (minimum 60 percent).
instructor:
Blended:
A blended (hybrid) course is a learning environment where face-to-face teaching time is reduced, but not eliminated, to allow students more time for online study. The online component is normally 50% to 80% of the total course delivery. A blended course may have components delivered via traditional face-to-face; however, at least half of the course delivery is online.
